title: 112_s579
content: The Act is named the "Sergeant Coleman S. Bean Reserve Component Suicide Prevention Act" and addresses suicide prevention among members of the Individual Ready Reserve and Individual Mobilization Augmentees. Congress finds that veterans in certain reserve components are less likely to benefit from existing suicide prevention programs. The Secretary of Defense is required to ensure that these members receive a specific telephone call for suicide prevention. The Secretary of Defense ensures that covered members in specific reserve components receive a telephone call every 90 days to assess their emotional, psychological, medical, and career needs. Personnel making the call must refer at-risk members to appropriate medical facilities for immediate evaluation. The Secretary of Defense ensures that covered members in specific reserve components receive regular assessments for emotional, psychological, medical, and career needs. Referrals are made for immediate evaluation and treatment by qualified mental health care providers. Reports are submitted annually to Congress on the number of members referred for counseling or mental health treatment, along with their health and career status, and any issues related to resources, regulations, or statutes. The term 'covered member' in this section refers to specific reserve component members who have deployed to Afghanistan or Iraq in support of a contingency operation after September 11, 2001. The counseling calls for these members may be impeded by resource, regulatory, or statutory issues. The term 'covered member' in this section refers to reserve component members deployed to Afghanistan or Iraq in support of a contingency operation after September 11, 2001. A new item is added to the table of sections in the chapter. The Comptroller General and the Secretary of Defense will submit a report to Congress on suicide prevention for certain reserve members. The Secretary of Defense is required to develop and disseminate programs, including peer counseling, to prevent suicide among members of the Armed Forces. The Secretary of Defense is mandated to widely disseminate programs promoting connectedness and suicide risk identification among members of the Armed Forces, with a focus on Reserve Components.
